intro: Psychotria pseudoplatyphylla, commonly known as the false flat-leaf Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, often with a distinctive scent. It is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
